meanings.definition: Flavones: a type of chemical compound found in plants
meanings.sent1: The flavones in the plant help it grow strong and healthy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study flavones to learn more about plant chemistry.
meanings.sent3: The flavones in the flower made it smell like a delicious fruit.
meanings.sent4: Herbal teas are like a bouquet of flavones, bringing nature's goodness.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the flavones brightened up the garden.

meanings.definition: Flavones: compounds that have antioxidant properties
meanings.sent1: Eating foods rich in flavones can help protect your cells.
meanings.sent2: Health experts recommend including flavones in your diet for better health.
meanings.sent3: The flavones in the berries fought off the harmful effects of free radicals.
meanings.sent4: Her smoothie was a blend of flavones, a shield against aging.
meanings.sent5: The flavones acted like tiny superheroes, defending the body from harm.

meanings.definition: Flavones: a group of flavonoids with a specific chemical structure
meanings.sent1: The flavones share a similar structure that sets them apart from other compounds.
meanings.sent2: Chemists can identify flavones based on their distinct chemical makeup.
meanings.sent3: At the science fair, the flavones danced together in a molecular parade.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chemicals, flavones stand out like stars in the sky.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the intricate patterns of flavones amazed the researchers.
